metadata.Title: CVE-2019-10871 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in Poppler 0.74.0. There is a heap-based buffer over-read in the function PSOutputDev::checkPageSlice at PSOutputDev.cc.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-10871` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-poppler-0.18 - 0.86.1-0ubuntu1
libpoppler-cpp0v5 - 0.86.1-0ubuntu1
libpoppler-glib8 - 0.86.1-0ubuntu1
libpoppler-qt5-1 - 0.86.1-0ubuntu1
libpoppler97 - 0.86.1-0ubuntu1
poppler-utils - 0.86.1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> this is an invalid read of size 1. Upstream fixed this issue by enabling SPLASH_CMYK in poppler.  Enabling SPLASH_CMYK introduced a regression in xpdf and gdal. See bug 1905741.

criterions.comment: poppler package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.86.1-0ubuntu1').
